channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dreaming of a Black Utopia in Trump's America
item.description: In his new book, The Black Utopians, author Aaron Robinson tells the story of how Black folks have created many different versions of utopian communit...

item.title: The secrets of cork: So much more than a bottle stopper
item.description: The sound of a bottle popping may be a familiar harbinger of good, but the humble material behind the pop has more uses than you might imagine.

item.title: Man arrested in 1985 church murders after original suspect exonerated
item.description: Erik Sparre was arrested in the 1985 killings of Harold and Thelma Swain after the original suspect, Dennis Perry, was exonerated on DNA evidence, aut...

item.title: South Korean defense chief jailed over martial law order attempts suicide
item.description: A prison official says South Korea's ex-defense chief Kim Yong Hyun tried to kill himself after being arrested over the martial law declaration he's a...

item.title: Through 'The Loss Mother's Stone,' mothers share their grief from losing a child to stillbirth
item.description: Through her work, photographer Nancy Borowick says she hopes to draw awareness to women's stories, educate Americans and destigmatize the conversation...

item.title: House panel to hear long-awaited Blinken testimony on Afghanistan exit
item.description: The secretary of state's testimony comes months after Republicans issued a scathing report on the Biden administration's handling of the exit from Afg...

item.title: 'I want justice': Victims of Syria chemical attacks speak freely for first time
item.description: The UN's chemical watchdog says dozens were killed in a chemical attack in Eastern Ghouta in 2018.

item.title: From wealth and success to murder suspect, the life of Luigi Mangione took a hard turn
The 50 men accused in mass rape of Gisèle Pelicot
item.description: The men accused of raping Gisèle Pelicot have been dubbed Monsieur-Tout-Le-Monde as they broadly represent a microcosm of French society.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO was likely killed with a ghost gun that can be made at home
Trump's withdrawn nominees latest in a long line of Cabinet members who never were
item.description: Many presidents face failed Cabinet picks so when former Rep. Matt Gaetz withdrew from consideration for President-elect Donald Trump's Cabinet, it wa...

item.title: Judge rejects bankruptcy sale of Alex Jones' Infowars to The Onion
item.description: The judge criticized the auction process as flawed and said the outcome "left a lot of money on the table" for Sandy Hook families.

item.title: GM to retreat from robotaxis and stop funding its Cruise autonomous vehicle unit
item.description: The automaker will focus on development of partially automated driver-assist systems for personal vehicles like its Super Cruise, which allows drivers...

item.title: The Onion's purchase of Alex Jones's Infowars rejected by judge
item.description: Judge Christopher Lopez ruled that an auction for Infowars did not result in the best bids possible.

item.title: Luigi Mangione fights extradition to face charge of murdering CEO
item.description: The 26-year-old was arrested in Pennsylvania, and prosecutors are seeking to bring him to trial in New York.

item.title: Suspect in the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO struggles, shouts while entering courthouse
item.description: The suspect in the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO struggled with deputies and shouted while arriving for a court appearance in Pennsylvania a day a...

item.title: Lawyer cites 300 potential cases against Diddy
item.description: US lawyer Tony Buzbee says he still receives daily calls with new allegations about the music mogul.

item.title: One family thought they had left Syria forever. After Assad's fall, they plan to return
item.description: Rehab Alkadi and her husband, Feras, fled Syria's war with their young son in 2013. They and other Syrian refugees in the U.S. are now hopeful for the...
